sn1.36:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn1.36:4.2: Then, late at night, several beautiful gods of the Satullapa Group, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
sn1.36:4.3: bowed, and stood to one side.
sn1.36:4.4: Standing to one side, one deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.36:5.4: and when they discard this corpse they go to heaven.”
sn1.36:6.1: Then another deity recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.36:7.1: “You should give up anger and get rid of conceit,
sn1.36:7.2: and get past all the fetters.
sn1.36:7.3: Clingings don’t torment the one who has nothing,
sn1.36:7.4: not clinging to name and form.”
sn1.36:9.3: For if you’re diligent and practice absorption,
